CatDescriptText: Mrs. Gertrude Brodet, housewife, 2191 Elmore Square, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 18, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think parents should permit teen-agers to smoke, particularly those who still are in school?" answer reads: "I do not. In the first place, smoking is nerve wracking and it doesn't give the child time to think and to do his work adequately, because it puts too much pressure on the brain and the mind."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gertrude Brodet wearing light colored coat with dark button, standing in front of stone building with store window on right
